data.title: This Is What College Hoops Coaches Like to Watch While Stuck at Home
data.meta_description: This Is What College Hoops Coaches Like to Watch While Stuck at Home - Post
data.text:
Along with the rest of the sports world, college basketball has been shut down due to the coronavirus. Since coaches can’t go out and recruit, they’re stuck at home like the rest of us. Sure, they make calls, but many of them are watching movies and catching up on their shows.

To try and come up with something fun and light in these uncertain times, I asked all of the 342 Division 1 head coaches (there are eight openings) to name their favorite film and TV program — and 337 responded.

A few, including Patrick Ewing and Johnny Dawkins, said they didn’t have any favorites. Only two had the same choices as me (Seinfeld and Gladiator).

Bob Huggins’ picks were exactly what you thought they would be, Roy Williams went way back for his favorite movie, Tom Izzo and Lorenzo Romar love the same show, and John Calipari and Richard Pitino are fans of the same movie.

Admittedly, I’ve never heard of Penny Hardaway’s favorite film — and make sure to find out which coach picked The Bachelor as their favorite TV show (there was only one).

Will Brown, Albany

Movie: Hoosiers

TV Show: Blue Bloods

Tommy Dempsey, Binghamton

Movie: The Shawshank Redemption
